Seems like a lot of overhead having the jQuery library loaded for some simple JS doesn’t it?

True, however providing the user’s cache hasn’t been deleted on the client’s machine within the past hour or so of browsing, that file should already be cached from other site’s references to the file. Of course you probably already know that but still
You’re completely right though, I’ve found the difference to be miniscule in real world load time tests, particularly with the aforementioned point, and jQuery just makes everything oh so simple
